The Family Mediation Council has more information on the [mediation process](https://www.familymediationcouncil.org.uk/family-mediation/) and how it can benefit you.

The [Separated Parents Information Programme](https://www.cafcass.gov.uk/grown-ups/parents-and-carers/divorce-and-separation/separated-parents-information-programme/) helps you understand how to put your children first and manage disputes with the other parent. There are similar programmes in [Wales](http://cafcass.gov.wales/info_for_adults/working_together_for_children_course/?skip=1&lang=en) and [Scotland](https://www.relationships-scotland.org.uk/family-support/parenting-apart-groups).

Download a [mediation information pack](https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/489124/family-mediation-leaflet.pdf) from the Ministry of Justice.

Advice Now has a [guide to using mediation](https://www.advicenow.org.uk/guides/survival-guide-using-family-mediation-after-break) following separation.

[Listen to real mediation stories](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLe8vyktlR0b30Yd7lJyGLErjf22o-Ej32) from a University of Exeter study.

Find out more about [lawyer-assisted mediation](https://www.divorce.co.uk/divorce-approaches/mediation-with-lawyers).

[Find a local mediator](https://www.familymediationcouncil.org.uk/find-local-mediator/)
heading: Professional mediation resources
